reviews.text:
Bustling seaside town. Great beach,shops ,choice of eateries.
Lots of walking

Charming little tourist resort 24 mls from Edinburgh.
Suggest you visit tourist info to find all that is on offer.
Good for bird enthusiasts with the Bass Rock and Scottish Seabird Centre at hand
Rarely get a train that's on time. Have only made one train neck to Edinburgh out of three, other two had been cancelled.

North Berwick is the rail terminus for trains from Edinburgh. This quaint little station has some covered seating and also a car park. The ScotRail trains using this station are well maintained and clean. ScotRail operates an hourly service on most days of the week.

Such a beautiful town / resort. The weather was sunny, hardly a cloud in the sky. Lots of colour in the tree's, shrubs and flowers. A walk / scramble up the maw, then a stroll down to the beach through the marsh, trees, gardens and parkland. A real hidden gem.
